intro: Vicia glauca var. mesatlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic vetch, is a variant of the common vetch native to the coastal regions of Europe and North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its trifoliate leaves and slender, climbing stems. The flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. This plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found along sea cliffs and dunes. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
